Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50 degrees Celsius. (2) The tertiary butyl group (C(C)C) is a bulky group that can add about +10 degrees Celsius due to steric hindrance and increasing the molecular volume. (3) The piperidine ring (N1CCCC1) and 1-ethyl-4-methylenepiperidine moiety may both add roughly +20 each due to adding more rigid ring structures and making the molecule more compact. (4) The moramide group (O=C(N1CCCC1)) includes functionalities related to amides, which can significantly increase the melting point due to hydrogen bonding, adding about +30. Summing these modifications gives us an estimated melting point shift.
